title: Kill Bill: The Whole Bloody Affair
notes: The Shaw brothers logo, the grind-house feature  presentation… this is Gahdamn exciting.. the Soundtrack and score slap So Hard!

title: Heroes Shed No Tears
notes: In the Korean Cut, The heroes do shed tears!...

title: Christmas Bloody Christmas
notes: It almost starts out as a hangout film. You dig these punk rock characters. You relate to the Conversations and topics debates on horror films, rock albums...

title: The Running Man
notes: It was alright…. I don’t like to be negative in any my reviews so… the positives.. Fast paced a ride, but I feel nothing was earned. It was too fast paced...

title: Black Christmas
notes: Pulpy, gory, Amusing. Not near the classic the original is. But at a brisk pace and in around under 90mins, this flew by! Well made! People under the stairs inspired, Halloweenesque,  slasher mishmash!. With a who’s who cast of the early 2000s. This stands on its own!

title: Time And Tide
notes: Very confusing. But stylish, Fantastic action but I’m baffled.!

title: Silent Night
notes: The return of John Woo to American movies.  On first watch when it came out, I thought it was good… But a friend of mine was right it gets better upon rewatches. It commits to its Premise and its gimmicks...

title: Djinn
notes: Tobe Hooper’s Final Film…

title: Behind The Mask: The Rise Of Leslie Vernon
notes: Solid Deconstruction of the genre horror entry. Great to see Robert Englund play a character again that isn’t evil. Fun winks and nods to horror.

title: Night Terrors
notes: This Movie is fucking bonkers. On the surface it seems bad, bad acting bad script, but For any hooper Fan, there’s lots to mine. A historical Exercise in sex cults, archaeology and Loss of innocence...

title: The Transporter
notes: This Movie is a vibe!…

title: Almost Heros
notes: Just A solid 90 min comedy. It’s a familiar 90s greatest hits of gags you’ve seen in other Films of that era. But done in its own way and still hilarious. Apparently this is Christopher Guest’s only Narrative non self aware style film...

title: The Killer
notes: Woo’s Reload is an elegant departure From his original, different enough… Not better But A serviceable Luc Besson style European actioner I say that with affection...

title: V For Vendetta
notes: Powerful, Moving, eye opening, relevant, entertaining. This film hit harder then ever before...

title: Punisher: War Zone
notes: If You squint You’ll see Steven Seagal is the punisher in this film. Does it make better ? Maybe...

title: The Punisher
notes: The first quarter Dark. The 2nd quarter sweet. The third quarter Fun.  All in all  lol still holds up. Actions is solid. Even if it rips off the Mad Max Family murder.

title: Prophecy
notes: This movie is shot really well, atmospheric  and is about important topics: corporate environmental pollution, human activism, Indigenous relations to logging companies...

title: King Kong
notes: A masterpiece. A grand adventure. Effects still hold up, a wonderful tribute to the original film while being worth and stands on its own merits...

title: Raw Deal
notes: They gave Schwarzenegger a raw deal… Nobody gives Schwarzenegger a Raw deal...

title: End Of Days
notes: In the top 5 Arnold Movies. One of his best performances. It falls into the age old adage is a hero is only as good as villain...

title: Phenomena
notes: Very atmospheric, creepy crawlies, A bit of a riff On Susperia. But Welcomed...

title: New Nightmare
notes: This film is very much about real Horrors. The fear of loosing your family. It’s amazing how...

title: Wishmaster
notes: Lots of great practical effects on display. Add in a late 90s Scream like atmosphere..

title: A Nightmare on Elm Street: The Dream Child
notes: While you get some great  sequences namely the uncut Motorbike taking over Alice’s boyfriend...

title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master
notes: The Goldfinger of Freddy Films. In 4K!

title: Play Dirty
notes: Gahdamn I had high hopes for this. But the nice guys it is not. Not even close. But Enjoyable, opening credits were very James Bond style...

title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors
notes: You know This series is not afraid to kill off its main and characters you care about! Something scream should have done a long time ago. Up the ante, up the stakes!

title: A Nightmare on Elm Street
notes: Wes Craven’s Masterpiece. The atmosphere, the creepin score, the performances The sheer brilliance of the very idea of a dream demon still hold up so strongly today...

title: Freddy’s Dead: The Final Nightmare
notes: You know what it’s fun. Not taken as a scary horror movie and more as a zainy tour de force...
